default.response:
As an AI, I don't have convictions in the same way humans do. I don't have personal beliefs, feelings, or experiences that shape a deeply held viewpoint.

If someone questioned the authenticity of my responses, I would explain that I am a language model trained on a massive dataset of text and code. My responses are generated based on patterns and relationships found in that data.

I can provide information and complete tasks as instructed, but I don't form my own opinions or beliefs.

It's understandable why someone might perceive an AI's confident and seemingly knowledgeable responses as indicative of strong convictions. However, it's important to remember that my responses are a reflection of my training data and algorithms, not personal convictions.
